newsitem.title: USA: Assets of U.S. money market funds fell in week.
newsitem.headline: Assets of U.S. money market funds fell in week.

text.p: Total assets of U.S. money market mutual funds fell to $959.79 billion this week from a revised $961.58 billion last week, an industry trade group said Thursday.
The Investment Company Institute said assets of the nation's 664 retail money market mutual funds rose $4.74 billion to $634.87 billion in the week.

Of the retail funds, assets of the 401 taxable money market funds rose $4.35 billion to $517.10 billion, while assets of the 263 tax-exempt funds rose $390.8 million to $117.78 billion, the group said.

ICI said assets of the 323 institutional money market funds fell $6.52 billion to $324.92 billion. Of these, assets of the 260 taxable money market funds decreased $6.24 billion to $292.94 billion, while assets of the 63 tax-exempt funds fell $282.7 million to $31.98 billion, it said.
ICI revised last week's money market mutual fund assets to $961.58 billion from $953.32 billion.
